content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
My name is Martina Hogg and I am making a Freedom of Information request. Please provide the following information.
•	Number of applications for a new licence in last 12 months
•	Number of applications for a licence renewals in last 12 months
•	Number of new licences granted as a result of an application made in the last 12 months
•	Number of licences renewed as a result of an application made in the last 12 months
•	If appropriate, grounds on which any licence (new or renewal) was refused.
•	A copy of each dog breeding licence currently issued.
•	Please confirm the number of staff and qualifications of staff employed by each licence holder (for the avoidance of doubt I am not requesting any details of individual staff, just number employed by each licence holder and the qualification(s) held)
•	When applying for a new licence or a renewal which of the following do you require in respect of the animals specified in the licence
o	Name
o	Gender
o	Age and/or date of birth
o	Microchip number
o	Breed
o	Description
o	Date of purchase
•	Where a breeder buys/sells a breeding dog during the period of an issued licence do you require them to notify you of the change at the time of the sale/purchase of the dog or are records only updated at the time of the renewal application?
•	What steps, if any, do you take to ensure that each breeder complies with The Microchipping of Dogs (England) 2015 regulations?
•	Number of staff employed to conduct inspections during last 12 months
•	Total number of inspections conducted during last 12 months
•	Number of litters produced (and number of puppies in each litter) by each licence holder
•	If you keep records of Kennel Club Assured Breeder Scheme members please confirm which licence holders are also members of this scheme
•	Price charged for new licence
•	Price charged for renewal of a licence
•	Has any licence been revoked or suspended in the last 12 months? If so, please provide details of licence holder and reason for revocation or suspension
•	Number of complaints received in the last 12 months and the name of the licence holder complained about. Where a complaint has resulted in enforcement action please confirm what enforcement action was taken and the name of the licence holder (or refer to answer above if details already provided in relation to revocation or suspension of licence)
I look forward to hearing from you.
Yours faithfully,
Martina

Dear Martina Hogg,
Thank you for your request for information relating to dog breeding
licences which we received on 26/10/2020.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Please be aware that Sheffield City Council’s response to the global
COVID-19 pandemic has led to a reduction in resources across the Council,
meaning that we are currently dealing with a backlog of requests.
We will aim to respond to your request within 20 working days, by
23/11/2020, but we kindly ask for your patience as we anticipate that
there may be a delay in some cases. Please do not hesitate to contact us
at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
P Please don't print this e-mail unless you really need to

Dear Martina Hogg,
Thank you for your request for information relating to dog breeding
licences which we received on 26/10/2020.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Please accept our apologies for the delay in the response.
•         Number of applications for a new licence in last 12 months
o 2
•         Number of applications for a licence renewals in last 12 months
o 1
•         Number of new licences granted as a result of an application
made in the last 12 months
o 2 – Awaiting report/issuing*
•         Number of licences renewed as a result of an application made in
the last 12 months
o 1 – Awaiting report/issuing*
*Note: The 3 applicationss that are outstanding cannot be issued as they
have not been inspected. Therefore we haven’t received a report and so the
licence cannot be attached to this email as requested.
•         If appropriate, grounds on which any licence (new or renewal)
was refused.
o N/A
•         A copy of each dog breeding licence currently issued. (you will
need to print and save each licence in folder and attach to your email
response to me)
See attached – 4 current licences and 3 awaiting
inspection/report/issuing. Please note that the names and addresses of
individuals have been redacted under section 40(2) of the Freedom of
Information Act 2000 on the grounds that these are personal data and
disclosure would contravene the data protection principle under Article
5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation that processing of
personal data must be fair, lawful and transparent.
•         Please confirm the number of staff and qualifications of staff
employed by each licence holder (for the avoidance of doubt I am not
requesting any details of individual staff, just number employed by each
licence holder and the qualification(s) held)
o [Address redacted] – 3 key holders
o Lyncham, 4 Thornbrook Gardens –1 key holder
o Barbarian Corso Kennel –1 key holder
o D&B Pups –1 key holder
•         When applying for a new licence or a renewal which of the
following do you require in respect of the animals specified in the
licence
o        Name - No
o        Gender - Yes
o        Age and/or date of birth – Yes
o        Microchip number - No
o        Breed - Yes
o        Description - No
o        Date of purchase - No
•         Where a breeder buys/sells a breeding dog during the period of
an issued licence do you require them to notify you of the change at the
time of the sale/purchase of the dog or are records only updated at the
time of the renewal application?
o The licence holder should notify the licensing service of any changes
in regards to the licence ASAP. The licence holder is required to
complete a Variation application so that we can get the licence
amended and up to date. The licence holder should also always keep
records of sales/purchases of any dog.
•         What steps, if any, do you take to ensure that each breeder
complies with The Microchipping of Dogs (England) 2015 regulations?
o At any visit the law relating to microchipping is discussed with
breeders
o Breeders are asked if they are observing the microchip regulations
o Where appropriate, paperwork is asked for to show that puppies are
microchipped before sale
o Should it be evident that a breeder has failed their duty, Animal
Control would consider legal proceedings
•         Number of staff employed to conduct inspections during last 12
months
o There are 3 Animal Control Officers
•         Total number of inspections conducted during last 12 months
5 visits have been conducted by Animal Control in the last 12
months
•         Number of litters produced (and number of puppies in each
litter) by each licence holder
No records are kept on our systems but the licence holder should always
keep records.
•         If you keep records of Kennel Club Assured Breeder Scheme
members please confirm which licence holders are also members of this
scheme
We don’t keep records of Kennel Club Assured Breeder Scheme Members
•         Price charged for new licence - £465.70
•         Price charged for renewal of a licence - £465.70
•         Has any licence been revoked or suspended in the last 12 months?
If so, please provide details of licence holder and reason for revocation
or suspension
No
•         Number of complaints received in the last 12 months and the name
of the licence holder complained about. Where a complaint has resulted in
enforcement action please confirm what enforcement action was taken and
the name of the licence holder (or refer to answer above if details
already provided in relation to revocation or suspension of licence)
Animal Control have received three complaints about a dog breeder in
Sheffield in the last 12 months. The complaints were investigated and
legal proceedings are in preparation. However, we are unable to provide
details of the breeder complained about as this is personal information
and so is exempt from disclosure under section 40(2) of the Freedom of
Information Act 2000 on the grounds that disclosure would contravene the
data protection principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data
Protection Regulation that processing of personal data must be fair,
lawful and transparent.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by either writing to the above address or by emailing
[2][Sheffield City Council request email]. Internal review requests should be submitted
within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]www.ico.org.uk for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [4][Sheffield City Council request email]
P Please don't print this e-mail unless you really need to
show quoted sections

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please pass this on to the person who conducts Freedom of Information reviews.
I am writing to request an internal review of Sheffield City Council's handling of my FOI request 'Dog Breeding Licences'.
The copy dog breeding licences provided have been redacted to such an extent that it is not possible to identify the licence holder. In your response you have explained that the redactions relate to S40 and GDPR.
S40 of the Act does not prohibit the provision of personal data. S40 calls for a balance to be struck between data protection principles and the need for transparency.
I believe that the request is lawful, fair and transparent. There would be no point in having a licensing regime in place if nobody can identify who the licence holders are.
The purpose of the request is to identify licence holders, the number of breeding dogs kept by each licence holder, the star rating of each licence holder and any special conditions that attach to each licence. I believe there is a legitimate interest in collecting this data.
In the event that the licence holder trades from a residential address I agree that it would be appropriate to redact the address on the licence. I also agree that it is appropriate to redact the signature and the name of any council employee identified on the licence.
I look forward to hearing from you
Yours faithfully,
Martina

Dear Martina Hogg,
Thank you for your recent request for an internal review relating to dog
breeding licences which we received on 18/01/2021. We are sorry to hear
that you are not happy with your response.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team
You should expect to hear a response from us by 15/02/2021.
While we endeavour to fulfil statutory deadlines, due to the current
pandemic situation there may be delays due to resourcing shortages. We
will try to provide updates where possible.
In the meantime, if you have any queries please, contact us at the email
address below.
Thank you.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]

Dear Martina
I am writing regarding the internal review you requested of FOI
2020-21-2760.  We received your request for review on 17/01/2021 and we
endeavour to provide a response to internal reviews within 20 working
days. However a review can sometimes be delayed and I apologise that it
has taken over the 20 working days to respond to you.
In your request, you specifically asked for the following information:
•             Number of applications for a new licence in last 12 months
•             Number of applications for a licence renewals in last 12
months
•             Number of new licences granted as a result of an application
made in the last 12 months
•             Number of licences renewed as a result of an application
made in the last 12 months
•             If appropriate, grounds on which any licence (new or
renewal) was refused.
•             A copy of each dog breeding licence currently issued.
•             Please confirm the number of staff and qualifications of
staff employed by each licence holder (for the avoidance of doubt I am not
requesting any details of individual staff, just number employed by each
licence holder and the qualification(s) held)
•             When applying for a new licence or a renewal which of the
following do you require in respect of the animals specified in the
licence
o             Name
o             Gender
o             Age and/or date of birth
o             Microchip number
o             Breed
o             Description
o             Date of purchase
•             Where a breeder buys/sells a breeding dog during the period
of an issued licence do you require them to notify you of the change at
the time of the sale/purchase of the dog or are records only updated at
the time of the renewal application?
•             What steps, if any, do you take to ensure that each breeder
complies with The Microchipping of Dogs (England) 2015 regulations?
•             Number of staff employed to conduct inspections during last
12 months
•             Total number of inspections conducted during last 12 months
•             Number of litters produced (and number of puppies in each
litter) by each licence holder
•             If you keep records of Kennel Club Assured Breeder Scheme
members please confirm which licence holders are also members of this
scheme
•             Price charged for new licence
•             Price charged for renewal of a licence
•             Has any licence been revoked or suspended in the last 12
months? If so, please provide details of licence holder and reason for
revocation or suspension
•             Number of complaints received in the last 12 months and the
name of the licence holder complained about. Where a complaint has
resulted in enforcement action please confirm what enforcement action was
taken and the name of the licence holder (or refer to answer above if
details already provided in relation to revocation or suspension of
licence)
I have carried out an Internal Review of the handling of your request.
The intention of an internal review is to consider if we handled your
response in accordance with the law and to consider if any decisions made,
for example to refuse information, were correct and still apply.
Firstly Section 10 of the Freedom of Information Act states that Sheffield
City Council must respond to requests made under the Freedom of
Information Act within 20 working days of receipt.  In this case, your
request was received by Sheffield City Council on 27/10/2020 and was
responded to on 17/12/2020.
You were concerned that
The copy dog breeding licences provided have been redacted to such an
extent that it is not possible to identify the licence holder. In your
response you have explained that the redactions relate to S40 and GDPR.
S40 of the Act does not prohibit the provision of personal data. S40 calls
for a balance to be struck between data protection principles and the need
for transparency.
Following our internal review, the Council upholds the following decision:
Please note that the names and addresses of individuals have been redacted
under section 40(2) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 on the grounds
that these are personal data and disclosure would contravene the data
protection principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection
Regulation that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and
transparent.
If you are dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you are
entitled to contact the Information Commissioner’s Office and they will
consider whether your complaint is eligible for further review. The
Information Commissioner’s details and guidance is available on the
website at [1]www.ico.org.uk.
Kind regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [2][Sheffield City Council request email]
Andrea Brown
Information Governance and Compliance Officer
Business Change and Information Solutions (BCIS)
Resources Portfolio, Sheffield City Council

intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Good afternoon,
I am writing in relation to an internal review response you will have
received on the 29/07/2021. This email is incomplete and was sent to you
in error. Please disregard this response. A full internal review will be
provided to you within the next fortnight.
Kind regards
Holly
Holly McCready
Access to Information Officer
Information Management Team
Business Change and Information Solutions (BCIS)
Resources Portfolio, Sheffield City Council

endeavour to provide a response to internal reviews within 20 working

Dear Martina Hogg,
I am writing regarding the internal review you requested of FOI /
2020-21-2760.  We received your request for review on 18/01/2021 and we
endeavour to provide a response to internal reviews within 20 working
days. Please accept our apologies for the lengthy delay in responding to
your request, and for any inconvenience this may have caused you. We have
been dealing with a backlog of Internal Reviews, and also had to
reprioritise some of our work to focus on the ongoing coronavirus
pandemic, which has led to a shortage of resources.
I have carried out an Internal Review of the handling of your request.
The intention of an internal review is to consider if we handled your
response in accordance with the law and to consider if any decisions made,
for example to refuse information, were correct and still apply.
You were concerned that:
The copy dog breeding licences provided have been redacted to such an
extent that it is not possible to identify the licence holder. In your
response you have explained that the redactions relate to S40 and GDPR.
S40 of the Act does not prohibit the provision of personal data. S40 calls
for a balance to be struck between data protection principles and the need
for transparency.
I believe that the request is lawful, fair and transparent. There would be
no point in having a licensing regime in place if nobody can identify who
the licence holders are.
The purpose of the request is to identify licence holders, the number of
breeding dogs kept by each licence holder, the star rating of each licence
holder and any special conditions that attach to each licence. I believe
there is a legitimate interest in collecting this data.
In the event that the licence holder trades from a residential address I
agree that it would be appropriate to redact the address on the licence. I
also agree that it is appropriate to redact the signature and the name of
any council employee identified on the licence.
I uphold your argument that the documents have been over-redacted. At the
time of response, it was not clear to the FOI team if the copies of the
license or specific elements of the licenses were within the public
domain. Due to previous concerns from dog breeders relating to the
vulnerability of theft in the disclosure of their personal information, it
was decided at the time to redact the names and residential addresses of
the dog breeders. Upon reflection, I agree that the name of the dog
breeders should not have been redacted. This is further asserted through
the publication of the Breeding and Sale of Dogs Register via the
Licensing website here: [1]Public Client Search - Breeding and Sale of
Dogs (sheffield.gov.uk). Residential addresses will still be redacted for
the protection of the dog breeders’ personal safety.
I have supplied freshly redacted copies of the licenses requested at the
time of the FOI request. You will note that some names are still redacted,
names of historic dog breeders are exempt under Section 40(2) of the
Freedom of Information Act (Personal Data) as to release these names would
now be in breach of the Data Protection Act and General Data Protection
Regulations.
I apologise that the documentation was previously over-redacted. Thank you
for the opportunity to allow us to revise our redaction practices which is
often a continuous learning process.
If you are dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you are
entitled to contact the Information Commissioner’s Office and they will
consider whether your complaint is eligible for further review. The
Information Commissioner’s details and guidance is available on the
website at [2]www.ico.org.uk.
Kind regards,
Holly
Holly McCready
Access to Information Officer
Information Management Team
Legal and Governance Services
Resources Portfolio, Sheffield City Council
Email: [3][Sheffield City Council request email]
Postal Address: Sheffield City Council,  PO Box 1283, Sheffield S1 1UJ
